channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Google fires 28 staff after protests against cloud contract with Israel
item.description: Tech giant says employees engaged in 'completely unacceptable behaviour' during sit-in at company offices.

item.title: Can Sunil Kanugolu bring India’s Modi down, 10 years after helping him win?
item.description: As India's election kicks off, a top election strategist is looking for cracks in the Modi brand he helped create.

item.title: US chef’s bid to own ‘chili crunch’ name raises ire in Indonesia, Malaysia
item.description: David Chang tried to enforce a trademark for chilli condiment popular across Asia before backing down and apologising.

item.title: Iranian media says three drones downed after explosions heard in Isfahan
item.description: ABC News earlier reported Israel had launched a missile attack on a target in Iran, citing a senior US official.

item.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested as Columbia clears encampment
item.description: New York-based university moves to suspend students involved as police arrest them for trespassing.

item.title: Boeing hit with 32 whistleblower claims, as dead worker’s case reviewed
item.description: US workplace safety regulator received the complaints of employer retaliation over three-year period.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 785
item.description: As the war enters its 785th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: Full jury panel seated on third day of Trump’s New York hush-money trial
item.description: Two previously seated jurors were dismissed early in the day, but by the close of proceedings, 12 jurors had been named.

item.title: How do Muslims in India feel about the general election?
item.description: Muslims in India tell Al Jazeera why they are concerned about another term under Narendra Modi’s BJP government.

item.title: Is political unity in Somalia achievable?
item.description: President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud has called a meeting of regional leaders.

item.title: Poland arrests man over suspected plan to kill Ukraine’s Zelenskyy
item.description: Prosecutors say Polish national suspected of supplying information to Russian military intelligence.

item.title: ‘Unconscionable’: US sends dozens to Haiti on deportation flight
item.description: Deportations 'could be a death sentence', advocates say, as gang violence and instability grip the Caribbean country.

item.title: Kenya’s military chief among 10 people killed in helicopter crash
item.description: Air force sends an investigative team to establish cause of crash that killed General Francis Ogolla.

item.title: Satellite images reveal Israeli destruction of hospitals in Gaza
item.description: New analysis of satellite images by Al Jazeera's Sanad agency reveals the extent of damage to 24 hospitals in Gaza.

item.title: ‘How does UN recognition harm peace?’, asks Palestinian UN rep
item.description: Palestinian representative to the UN, Ziad Abu Amr has told the UN Security Council that granting Palestinians a soverei

item.title: US blocks Palestinian push for full UN membership at Security Council
item.description: US vetoes UN Security Council resolution that recommended the State of Palestine's full membership in the world body.

item.title: Jeffrey Sachs on why UN should vote for Palestinian statehood
item.description: Marc Lamont Hill discusses Palestinian statehood with Jeffrey Sachs ahead of the UN Security Council vote on membership.

item.title: Maldives High Court overturns ex-President Abdulla Yameen’s prison sentence
item.description: Decision comes days before the Indian Ocean archipelago nation holds parliamentary elections.

item.title: US imposes new sanctions on Iran after attack on Israel
item.description: Sanctions on Iran's missile and drone programmes come as fears mount over possibility of greater regional escalation.

item.title: Photos: The destruction of the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli army left a trail of destruction when it withdrew from the Nuseirat refugee camp.

item.title: Students rename Canadian university buildings after Palestinian places
item.description: Student activists at a university in Canada have ‘renamed’ dozens of campus buildings to places in Palestine.

item.title: German far-right politician on trial for alleged use of banned Nazi slogan
item.description: Bjorn Hocke, leader of the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party in Thuringia, faces three years in prison if convicted.

item.title: Israel’s response to Iran and the factors that will shape it
item.description: Matters both domestic and international are shaping Israel's response to Iran's attack.

item.title: Holding Up the Sky: Saving the Indigenous Yanomami tribe in Brazil’s Amazon
item.description: A Brazilian tribal leader warns that illegal mining in forests will have dire consequences for the rest of the world.

item.title: Israeli attack on nuclear sites to prompt tit-for-tat, pursuing nukes: Iran
item.description: Iran warns Israel that retaliation for recent attack would prompt Tehran to pursue nuclear weapon and respond in kind.
